quote: A wet man does not fear the rain.
author: Risa Rodil

quote: Patience is the art of hoping.
author: Luc de Clapiers

quote: Care is a state in which something does matter; it is the source of human tenderness.
author: Rollo May

quote: Are you really sure that a floor can't also be a ceiling?
author: M. C. Escher

quote: Unless a tree has borne blossoms in spring, you will vainly look for fruit on it in autumn.
author: Walter Scott

quote: I love Mickey Mouse more than any woman I have ever known.
author: Walt Disney

quote: How do you know you're going to do something, untill you do it?
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: What does it matter how many lovers you have if none of them gives you the universe?
author: Jacques Lacan

quote: Nature scarcely ever gives us the very best; for that we must have recourse to art.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: All theory, dear friend, is gray, but the golden tree of life springs ever green.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: I want my children to have all the things I couldn't afford. Then I want to move in with them.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: A mother's arms are made of tenderness and children sleep soundly in them.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Mother is the name for God in the lips and hearts of little children.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: There is nothing in the world of art like the songs mother used to sing.
author: Billy Sunday

quote: Sometimes the strength of motherhood is greater than natural laws.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: If evolution really works, how come mothers only have two hands?
author: Milton Berle
